number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 27, 2016
												Obviously you have to like poker. Players this time around are Brock Sampson from Venture Bros (I’ve only seen a very little bit of that show), Claptrap from Borderlands (I usually find him annoying), Ashley Williams (I didn’t know that was his name) from Army of Darkness, and Sam from Sam & Max. So yea, it’s poker, with witty banter from some interesting characters. I pretty much suck at poker, so don’t ever expect to play with me for real money. The banter was good, there were some interesting stories told, I was usually happy when claptrap was eliminated. Sam seemed to consistently lose first, Brock seemed to be the best, though Ash was up there. I lost 2-3 tourneys and won one. They added “bounties” which you have to complete so you can have the chance to win one of the “big” items from the game. I quit when I was in the middle of a tourney to win Brock’s sphere-o-mystery, whatever it was. One thing they added in this one that I thought was cool was every tourney you get tokens, and then with tokens you can buy new chips, cards, or table felt. Nothing big, but changes the look up. The banter and stories get repetitive after a while. Ash’s voice isn’t (I don’t think anyway) genuine, but it’s close. Everyone else is the original actors. \Oh yea and you can buy drinks for other players with tokens as well. The more they drink (apparently, I never actually bought anyone a drink) the worse decisions they make?Oh, and GLADoS is the narrator. She pops her head in at random times and makes various comments on how we’re all going to die “it’s a statistical certainty that 80% of you will lose and 100% of you will die. Isn’t math fun?” and other such things. Apparently players have tells, but like I said, I’m not very good at poker. Though maybe I shouldn’t be able to pick them up from only an hours play.But yea, it’s poker, so I guess there’s that.

Especially since Sam has brought Max into the inventory once again, so he often interjects, mimics and/or brandishes his gun to humourous effect now that he's not tied to the table. Ash and Brock are fairly non-energetic conversationalists, but you need someone to balance the Claptrap/Sam+Max hilarity, and Glados just demeans everyone.The tournament organiser also interjects more often, lending an offended upper class voice to the conversation.Getting the players drunk would likely affect the conversation as well.In all, I think the conversations in this game are more humourous and varied than the first.As for the Poker, Omaha seems like a much more interesting game than Texas, purely because your hole cards afford more viability in potential flops. So your hand is far less likely to be crap or excellent until that river goes down. As a result you see more rivers and can then bet intelligently off that information.Some things could be improved, such as not looking over every characters shoulder when watching the remainder of the match. Just put the values down beneath their name or split the screen, otherwise it takes too much time.But the poker's better, the characters and conversation better (all though get back to me after I've memorised all the lines), and the prize distribution less frustrating to those who can play. This is probably the best poker game I've played.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 22, 2016
												Poker for people with no friends to play poker with.  Like me!  And probably you.Stand Out Features: True to character personas from various popular media all playing poker at your table.  Detailed stages full of little references and overall polish.  Unlockable incentives to keep playing.Pros: Sharp writing for all the characters.  Gameplay plenty engaging for novice poker players.  Characters more recognizable compared to the prior game's cast.  Claptrap, true to his character, becomes annoying.Cons: Lines start repeating after just an hour or two of gameplay.  Game becomes less stimulating as characters leave the table.  I can't confirm the game will adjust draws to create big upsets in a hand, but said upsets happen enough to warrent suspicion.  Claptrap, true to his character, becomes annoying.Would Recommend To: Fans of the specific media from which these characters come from (Anyone who considers themselves a fan of Claptrap should immediately add this to their must buy list).  Fans of poker that want to hear some clever banter and jokes during hands.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 10, 2015
												Contrary to so many positive reviews, there are some serious issues with this game.  1) Usability.  There are unskippable scenes within the game - even when clicking "skip to next hand".  You have to sit through scenes when all you want to do is play the next hand.  2) In too many cases the game doesn't know how to play Poker.  It doesn't know how to match cards - namely, when you have a flush vs. a straight vs. a full house, or even a 2 pair.  It's key that none of the issues are with how the game is played, but rather how the game counts cards.  It's up in the air whether it's more frustraing that the game can't figure out if you have 2 pair vs. waiting for some silly cutscene when you select "skip to the next hand."

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 17, 2016
												I`ve always wanted a good single player poker game that actually played realistically with decent characters. This game does that.It starts you off in a dark  underground pub or bar and introduces you to 4 characters, only two of which I recognised which was Ash, and not from the crappy tv series either.  I also recognised Max, while never having played the game, know by reputation. Or is he called sam? I get mixed up between the dog and bunny. However, the characters reveal their personalities as you play the game. It`s more slow a reveal than the first game, but nicely paced in my view.The characterisations and how they play is really the best part of the game. Some of the jokes and stories are great.You can buy drinks for your opponents to weaken their skills, a bit silly really and they never refuse. I would`ve preferred it without. Sexy bar lady though with an air of `can`t be be bothered` to her.You also have a  female voiced robot that deals the cards. i prefrred when the cards where just dealth naturally in the 1st game. She can be also highly annoying both in attitude and voice. I preferred the original way without the dumb dealer robot.Game feels a little easier to win. Maybe too easy. You can free extra tables and card design but there`s not much to free up.My main wish would be for more choice in characters with just as much depth to play against. Make it about 10 with clothing variety so each game feels fresh. Yes, it would be a fair amount of work, but I`d pay £30 for it.Anyway recommended.

												Poker night 2 is the sequel to Poker Night 1 (unsuprisingly) and Telltale games only improved from PN1. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 20, 2015
												Overall I enjoyed this game, it was nice to play poker against opponents from popular culture and that's exactly what I got this game for. But, in terms of just having a nice poker experience? The original was better.In my honest opinion, there are two three things to know about this game.1. The random card shuffler is not random.2. The original Poker Night 1 was better.3. Poker Night 2 is VERY repetitive.In short, the original was much more relaxed. I found the characters from the original game more fun to play with/against, and I enjoyed how it didn't play on its own gimmick. In the new version, being able to turn the entire room thematic is cool, but it really gets tiresome having the exact same ending sequence play over and over again with no variation. GLADOS as the dealer is irritating, yes insulting the player is kind of her thing, but I don't actually want to hear the dealer speaking when I'm trying to play. Many aspects of this game destroyed immersion for me, but bad stuff aside you get exactly what you asked for. A poker game with pop culture icons. Enjoy it! And make sure when you're done you open up Poker Night 1 for the full experience.

												Not a bad poker game. Depending on your experience with other TellTale titles you may prefer the previous version, like I do. I'm not as familiar with these characters - although the change is nice sometimes. I also enjoy playing Omaha instead of the usual hold 'em. I seem to have a few issues with Omaha mode, though. content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
												Why would you play video game poker? By yourself? Because of the hilarious and charming AI, of course! And I don't just mean GlaDOS. The whole cast is funny and delightful, enough so you might not even get so upset when they keep beating you on the river. Okay you might still get upset, but hey, it's not real money! They added some nifty table felt and card designs unique to each character, and that in turn also unlocks additional cut-scenes. Also you can play Omaha! Finally! (I actually didn't know that game type existed before this game). It's not a full blown Poker sim and if you wanted a really good Poker experience close to what you find in real life there are other games that do it better. But you won't be playing with people as fun to be around with as these four, I guarantee that much.

												If you're a fan of either Venture Bros, Borderlands, Army of Darkness or the Sam & Max franchise, I'd say the game is worth getting just to get the pretty sweet dialogues. As advertised, it's a Poker game, nothing fancy, just a few unlocks in the form of differently themed assets in the game - aaaand items for your TF2 inventory if you're into that.If you're worried about the writing, I think you can rest easy. There are a few in-joke game references from the franchises involved, but it doesn't come off as forced (at least in my opinion).Conclusion: A well polished poker game with dialogue and unlockables that'll keep you entertained for at least a few hours.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 18, 2015
												This is a fun game... for a  while.  For $5 or less, it is worth it.  The characters are entertaining until the dialog gets recycled, then it becomes annoying.  Especially when play completely halts until the story you've already heard is done being told.  And there's no way to skip it.  It would be nice if you could choose to get just the critical dialog to play the game, but it's all or none.  And the available subtitles are almost illegible.  The poker game itself is not that realistic.  If you played tight (only when you have good cards) you would win just about every game.  Sometimes a player will call a big bet when there's no way they can win.  I think the game is designed in your favor to make it easier and get you involved in more hands.  It seems like you get more lucky than you would in a real random draw of cards.  If you learned poker from this and were to enter a real game, I guarantee you would lose.  But if you're never going to do that and/or you realize how unrealistic the gameplay here is, then it can be fun.

Add onions and garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Add ground beef and cook until completely brown. 												Sure, Poker games are practically a dime a dozen.  But this is the one you should buy.  Why?  Well, you could play poker with emotionless icons. Or, you can play poker with Ash Williams (Army of Darkness), Brock Samson (Venture Bros.), Cl4p-Tr4p (Borderlands), and Sam (Sam & Max), while GLADoS (Portal) deals.  They have tales, they have tells.  The game becomes much more alive.  Stakes are high, but hopefully luck will be on your side.  Amazing game, everyone should give it a shot.

												In my opinion this game is the best simulator the exists when it comes to high-stakes poker groups. And I'm talkin' groups. Like a weekly poker group or back or the bar table. Not casinos.Because it's all about how well you can bluff and see others' tells. Every other poker game you're gonna play out there is just about the cards but this is about the people A brilliant bunch of funny characters whose jokes you'll hate to laugh at because they'll be at your own expense. But then that makes it so much sweeter when you steal the chips out from under them.My hours above don't reflect how much I've played this game. Bought it again after beating it on PS3. Play the game through till you get all the rewards and become the master. Then, you'll actually find you're better at poker in some ways. Depending on the right situation though -- don't go bettin' it all because of a video game now.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												If you want a good poker sim, get the first Poker Night game. This one is utter garbage. I'm by no means a pro level poker player, but I still know enough about it to know that this game does not care about your level of experience.Half of the point in poker is to bluff your opponents into thinking you've got a good hand when you have a crap one or vice versa. In this game, you CANNOT bluff. The AI simply doesn't let you. It knows when you have a good hand and knows when you have a bad one.Not only that but the AI gives you two choices in 90% of the hands. 1) Fold. 2) Go all in. Seriously. The number of times the computer decides to make one of them go all in is rediculous. So you can either go all in with a pair of jacks, thinking you'll come out on top when you get a third jack on the flop, only to be sent drowning at the river because one of the others somehow got a straight. Honestly, I hate to feel like I'm complaining about this because it could just be that I'm a bad player, but the number of complaints I'm seeing about how badly the AI was programmed in this game makes me think it isn't just me.If you want this game for the TF2/Borderlands items, don't waste your time. You won't get them unless you invest a lot of agonising hours into losing tournament after tournament. You could probably craft something better in TF2 anyway.Now I'm gonna go play some poker against some real people who will actually fall for a bluff every now and again.

content:
Posted: February 7, 2014
												Ever did like Poker Night 1? well it seems like they made a second one. Welcome to Poker Night 2. This isn't really a sequal but more so an updated version of its previous game. it has more features and more fun jokes than the last one. We remove the old characters from the first and bring in fresh ones. In the first game we had Strong Bad, Tycho, Max, and The Heavy though now we have Ash, Brock, the ever so loud mouth Claptrap and Sam. Poker Night 2 also contains the ability to buy drinks for characters and the more they drink the more they get drunk and eventually reveals their hand. It adds a lot of atmosphere compared to the original I give it a 9.5 out of 10.

												There are tons of poker simulators out there, but this title keeps things fresh by mixing characters from different mediums.  the characters play styles tend to mimic how they would (probably) play the game, Brock is aggresive while Sam plays more conservatively.
